content.description: Sit start with a good left hand hold, and a low right hand sloping gaston. Pull on and smack out the the arete before hitting a jug for the left hand. From here, figure out how to reach up to the lip of the boulder.
content.protection: 2 pads. There is a spike you sit on for the start.
content.location: This problem is found around the left side of the Prohibition Boulder on the next smaller boulder.

content.description: Start with your right hand on a dish on the sloper and your left under the roof on a side pull crimp. Pull on (think kneebar) and make the crux move up to the good hold on the arete. Roll right to a jug in the crack and then quest up the easier arete to the top.
content.location: This the the first arete you see when approaching from the trail that leads to Waimea.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a low sloper and right hand on the far right funky pistol grip sidepull. Pull on with difficulty and make a blind smack up to a good but sharp crimp found on the face. Once here, moving out left to a funky sidepull allows one to readjust the feet. Continue up the overhanging arete on some sharp crimps until you can rock over onto the face and punch for the jug at the top.
content.location: Go to the Bootleg, when looking at The Bootleg turn left and follow the boulder as far as you can go. At the end of it you'll find this boulder in a hole with the end of the Bootleg boulder leaning up against it.

content.description: This is a low left start to "Rip You a New One". Start with your left hand on a really bad small sidepull edge and right hand on a juggy undercling left of "Rip You a New One". Start with a high heel out right and pull on and either go left or right first. I found left first to be a harder single move but easier to link and ultimately that was the way I did it.
content.location: Follow The Bootleg boulder left til it ends, this is on the smaller boulder in the hole that The Bootleg boulder leans up against.

content.description: Start standing in the dihedral with a jug for the right hand and an okay hold for the left. Find a foot and move out left to a sweet two foot rail. Once here another move gains the giant 20 foot rail. Traverse the rail all the way left for a Crux transition into the arete. A few more smacks on slopey pinches and meat-hooks gains an easy topout.
content.protection: 4 pads and two spotters. The landing is pretty bad for the traverse sequence, but it becomes better for the crux and the topout.
content.location: This problem climbs the downhill face of the Boulder and traverses the giant rail all the way left to finish on the arete. This problem is found in between "Speak-Kneezy" and "The Bootleg".

content.description: Sit start the glorious 10-degree overhanging face on the obvious start hold. Pull-on and make a move left to a good crimp then work the side pulls and crimps to a long move to the lip. Top out on jugs.
content.location: This is on the white face or rock that faces away from the trail.

content.description: Sit start under the roof with an edge and an undercling. Pull on a make a big move to a big hold, figure out how to match, then continue left up the large hold.From here, keep climbing up the face with long tension moves and an exciting move to the lip.
content.protection: 4 pads. Move to the lip is cruxy.
content.location: This problem starts under the roof, in the pit directly under the face.

content.description: A big boulder with easy access from the trail to Waimea. This boulder is home to the classic Bootleg - V6 as well as a couple of other established lines and other exploration to be had.
